TUTORIAL.STAGE_0: Welcome to LinguaQuest! Here you will learn a new language while replaying your favorite stories.
TUTORIAL.STAGE_1: We recommend at least mid A2 level (preferably studying B1) for a more pleasant experience. Otherwise, it might be frustrating and you'll stop playing.
TUTORIAL.STAGE_2: In this tutorial, we'll see the basic functions of the app. We won't go over all details, as we understand you're eager to start learning ðŸ¤“ Feel free to swipe down to skip the tutorial.
TUTORIAL.STAGE_3: Below this message, you have the tabs to navigate. In this screen (Play), we see the stories available to play, their length and your progress.
TUTORIAL.STAGE_4: On top, you can see what language you are learning, and from what language, i.e. the language for translations. You can change this by selecting the button on the right.
TUTORIAL.STAGE_5: Let's press now on any story, and we'll review how to play.
TUTORIAL.STAGE_6: Exciting! So the "game" consists in guessing the word that is missing in the sentence. You have four possible answers, and one of them is correct.
TUTORIAL.STAGE_7: After selecting one option, the answer & translation will be revealed. Click "Next" to continue.
TUTORIAL.STAGE_8: If you want to see again any previous translation, show it again by pressing on it. Let's do it.
TUTORIAL.STAGE_9: Some translations might have errors. You can also press & hold on a sentence. This will copy it, so you can send it to your native friend, or double-check on Google Translate.
TUTORIAL.STAGE_10: Finally, we'll show what you can configure in Settings. Press the next button to explore.
TUTORIAL.STAGE_11: Here, you can change the sentences per round. Default is 2 but we recommend 10 for a better experience. Remember that to complete a round you need to correctly fill in all sentences.
TUTORIAL.STAGE_12: You can also configure how many previous rounds you want to show. In case you want to review the story if you come back after some days.
TUTORIAL.STAGE_13: And with the "reading mode" you don't have to guess. Just read. For those days you don't want to complicate ðŸ˜‰
